title: FizzBuzz
description:
Implement the classic FizzBuzz programming challenge.

## Requirements

Create a function `fizzbuzz(n: u32) -> String` that returns:
- `"FizzBuzz"` if n is divisible by both 3 and 5
- `"Fizz"` if n is divisible by 3 only
- `"Buzz"` if n is divisible by 5 only
- The number as a string otherwise

## Examples

- `fizzbuzz(1)` returns `"1"`
- `fizzbuzz(3)` returns `"Fizz"`
- `fizzbuzz(5)` returns `"Buzz"`
- `fizzbuzz(15)` returns `"FizzBuzz"`
- `fizzbuzz(7)` returns `"7"`
hints: The order of your conditions matters - check for FizzBuzz (divisible by both 3 AND 5) before checking for Fizz or Buzz individually
Use the modulo operator: n % 3 == 0 checks if n is divisible by 3
You can create a String literal with String::from("text") or "text".to_string()
Consider using if/else if/else or the match expression for cleaner code
